làn
soft; mushy; well-cooked and soft; to rot; to decompose; rotten; worn out; chaotic; messy; utterly; thoroughly; crappy; bad
мягкий; мягкий; хорошо приготовленные и мягкие; гнить; разложить; сгнивший; изношенный; хаотичный; грязный; крайне; тщательно; дерьмовый; Плохо

purpleculture_examples: 爛熟 [ làn shú ]: well cooked; to know thoroughly

• ⿰ Left to right

heisig_chinese_memo: The fire took too long to start burning so the gargoyle was able to wake up and spoiled the barbecue by eating all the food.
Ru_trainchinese: làn: (прил/нареч) размякший; гнилой, протухший; изношенный; в беспорядке; яркий, красочный; полностью, совершенно
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the fire (火) makes the fence (闌) sore
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The fire took too long to start burning so the gargoyle was able to wake up and spoiled the barbecue by eating all the food.
humanum_full_description_en:
"Shuowen" Xiaozhuan "爤", a variant of "燗". The official script is used as " bad ", from the sound of " fire " and " Lan ". "Said the text": "Lan, also from what sound Lan Lan fire, or from idle..." Duan Note: "scribe as bad, not from the Cottage." " What " that is " cooked ." The original meaning of " rotten " is to cook things thoroughly with fire. "dialect. Seventh ": "From the north of the river, between Zhao and Wei, the fire is cooked and it is rotten." The extension means that the food is overcooked or the fruit is overripe. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. Original taste": "So long and not bad, cooked but not rotten, sweet but not choking." Gao Luu's note: "Rotten, bad cooking." "Qi Min Yao Shu. Planting peaches: "If the peach is rotten from zero, it will be collected, and the inside will be in the urn, and the mouth will be covered by the thing."

" Rotten " means decay, festering. Such as "Zhuangzi. "Human World": "Suck its leaves, but the mouth is rotten and hurt." " Suck " means licking. "Huainanzi. "Suoshan" "Rotten Ashes Grow Flies", Gao Luu Note: "Rotten, rot."

" Rotten " means burns or scalds. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "Ding Gong for Three Years": "(Zui Zi) cast himself into the bed, wasted on the charcoal, rotten, and died." "Salt and Iron. "Xing Morality": "The upper and lower sides are fleeing, the falsehood is born, and there is justice. If you save the bad, you can't stop it." "Scorched head" originally refers to being burned by fire and in serious condition.

" Bad " means bright and brilliant. Such as "Poetry. Zheng Feng. "The girl says the cock crowing": "Zixing looks at the night, the stars are rotten." Nine songs. "The King in the Clouds": "The spirit is still curled up, but it is not young." Wang Yi's note: "Rotten, beautiful."

" Rotten " means familiarity and proficiency. For example, Lin Bu in the Northern Song Dynasty "Oushu": "When the dust deceives the ancient Lulu, what is the picture of the poor Bible." Liu Xianting of the Qing Dynasty "Guangyang Miscellaneous Notes. Volume Three: "His father is a bi and a stranger. He is rarely a thief. He has no knowledge of reading. It is the eradication of chaos in ancient and modern generations. The success or failure is as bad as the palm."

" Rotten " can also mean high or deep, the same as " very " and " extreme ." Such as Pu Songling's "Strange Tales of a Liao Zhai." "Huang Ying": "Since Chen took four leaks, and counted hundreds of pots, I was so drunk as mud, sleeping in the room." Chapter 3 of "The Scholars": "You are a loyal and useless person, so these words I I have to enlighten you so as not to make people laugh."
humanum_short_description_en: "Shuowen" Xiaozhuan "爤", a variant of "燗". The official script is used as " bad ", from the sound of " fire " and " Lan ". The original meaning is to cook things thoroughly with fire.
humanum_full_description:
《說文》小篆「爤」，異體作「燗」。隸書作「爛」，從「火」，「闌」聲。《說文》：「爤，孰也。从火蘭聲。燗，或从閒。」段玉裁注：「隸作爛，不从艸。」「孰」即「熟」。「爛」的本義是用火把東西煮到熟透。《方言．第七》：「自河以北，趙魏之間，火熟曰爛。」引申表示食物煮得過熟或瓜果過分成熟。如《呂氏春秋．本味》：「故久而不弊，熟而不爛，甘而不噥。」高誘注：「爛，失飪也。」《齊民要術．種桃》：「桃爛自零者，收取，內之於甕中，以物蓋口。」

　　「爛」表示腐爛、潰爛。如《莊子．人間世》：「咶其葉，則口爛而為傷。」「咶」表示舔。《淮南子．說山》「爛灰生蠅」，高誘注：「爛，腐。」

　　「爛」表示燒傷、燙傷。如《左傳．定公三年》：「（邾子）自投于床，廢于鑪炭，爛，遂卒。」《鹽鐵論．刑德》：「上下相遁，姦偽萌生，有司法之，若救爛撲焦不能禁。」「焦頭爛額」本指被火燒傷，情況嚴重，後引申表示狼狽窘迫的狀態。

　　「爛」表示光明、燦爛。如《詩．鄭風．女曰雞鳴》：「子興視夜，明星有爛。」《楚辭．九歌．雲中君》：「靈連蜷兮既留，爛昭昭兮未央。」王逸注：「爛，光貌也。」

　　「爛」表示熟悉、精通。如北宋林逋〈偶書〉：「一任塵欺古鹿盧，聖經窮爛更何圖。」清代劉獻廷《廣陽雜記．卷三》：「其父成璧，亦異人，少為群盜，未嘗讀書識之無，乃古今之世代治亂，是非成敗，爛如指掌。」

　　「爛」也可以表示程度高或深，同「甚」、「極」。如清代蒲松齡《聊齋志異．黃英》：「自辰以訖四漏，計各盡百壺，曾爛醉如泥，沉睡座間。」《儒林外史》第3回：「你是個爛忠厚沒用的人，所以這些話我不得不開導你，免得惹人笑話。」
humanum_short_description: 《說文》小篆「爤」，異體作「燗」。隸書作「爛」，從「火」，「闌」聲。本義是用火把東西煮到熟透。

(Simplified: 烂)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 闌 indicates the sound; 火 (fire) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 火 [ huǒ ] fire, flame; to burn; anger, rage
    • 闌 [ lán ] screen door, railing, fence
①因過熟而變得鬆軟：爛糊。煮爛。
②程度極深：臺詞背得爛熟。
③東西腐壞：腐爛。
④灼傷：焦頭爛額。
⑤崩潰，敗壞：敵人一天天爛下去。
⑥破碎：破爛。爛紙。
⑦頭緒雜亂：爛攤子。
⑧明，有光彩：爛銀槍。爛漫。

《說文》小篆「 爤 」，異體作「 燗 」。隸書作「 爛 」，從「 火 」，「 闌 」聲。《說文》：「爤，孰也。从火蘭聲。燗，或从閒。」段玉裁注：「隸作爛，不从艸。」「 孰 」即「 熟 」。「 爛 」的本義是用火把東西煮到熟透。《方言．第七》：「自河以北，趙魏之間，火熟曰爛。」引申表示食物煮得過熟或瓜果過分成熟。如《呂氏春秋．本味》：「故久而不弊，熟而不爛，甘而不噥。」高誘注：「爛，失飪也。」《齊民要術．種桃》：「桃爛自零者，收取，內之於甕中，以物蓋口。」 「 爛 」表示腐爛、潰爛。如《莊子．人間世》：「咶其葉，則口爛而為傷。」「 咶 」表示舔。《淮南子．說山》「爛灰生蠅」，高誘注：「爛，腐。」 「 爛 」表示燒傷、燙傷。如《左傳．定公三年》：「（邾子）自投于床，廢于鑪炭，爛，遂卒。」《鹽鐵論．刑德》：「上下相遁，姦偽萌生，有司法之，若救爛撲焦不能禁。」「焦頭爛額」本指被火燒傷，情況嚴重，後引申表示狼狽窘迫的狀態。 「 爛 」表示光明、燦爛。如《詩．鄭風．女曰雞鳴》：「子興視夜，明星有爛。」《楚辭．九歌．雲中君》：「靈連蜷兮既留，爛昭昭兮未央。」王逸注：「爛，光貌也。」 「 爛 」表示熟悉、精通。如北宋林逋〈偶書〉：「一任塵欺古鹿盧，聖經窮爛更何圖。」清代劉獻廷《廣陽雜記．卷三》：「其父成璧，亦異人，少為群盜，未嘗讀書識之無，乃古今之世代治亂，是非成敗，爛如指掌。」 「 爛 」也可以表示程度高或深，同「 甚 」、「 極 」。如清代蒲松齡《聊齋志異．黃英》：「自辰以訖四漏，計各盡百壺，曾爛醉如泥，沉睡座間。」《儒林外史》第3回：「你是個爛忠厚沒用的人，所以這些話我不得不開導你，免得惹人笑話。」

爛字的基本解释

爛
làn
见“烂”。

爛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［làn］
［《廣韻》郎旰切，去翰，來。］
“煉2”的被通假字。亦作“爤1”。“烂1”的繁体字。
(1)用火煮熟。
(2)指食物煮得很熟或瓜果过分成熟后的松软状态。
(3)形容物体呈稀糊状态。
(4)精通；极熟悉。
(5)犹甚；极。表示程度高或深。
(6)随意；随便。
(7)放荡，不节制。
(8)灼伤；烫伤。
(9)腐烂，腐败。
(10)破碎；破烂。
(11)形容毁伤严重。
(12)形容内心极其痛苦或焦急。
(13)头绪乱。参见“爛帳”、“爛攤子”。
(14)詈词。对人或物的蔑称。
(15)光明；明亮。
(16)色彩绚丽。
(17)众多貌。
(18)盛，茂盛。

爛字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　爛； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页687第25
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?郞旰切，瀾去聲。【廣韻】火熟。【揚子·方言】自河以北，趙魏之閒，火熟曰爛。【左傳·定三年】邾子自投于牀，廢于鑪炭爛。　又【廣韻】明也。【詩·鄭風】明星有爛。又【唐風】錦衾爛兮。又【大雅】爛其盈門。【史記·蕭何世家贊】何之勳爛焉。【司馬相如·子虛賦】明爛龍鱗。　又【公羊傳·僖十九年】魚爛而亡。【註】魚爛從內發。　又【司馬相如·上林賦】麗靡爛漫於前。【註】索隱曰：列女傳云：桀造爛漫之樂。　【廣韻】本作爤。【集韻】與燗，煉?同。　又【正韻】離閑切，音闌。【楚辭·九章】曾枝剡棘圓果搏兮，靑黃雜糅文章爛兮。【韓愈·江漢詩】凄風結衝波，狐裘能禦寒。終宵處幽室，華燭光爛爛。◎按集韻類篇別作?。亦作爤。

爛字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
爛字的起名意思

暂无。

rotten
Basic explanation of words
rotten
làn
See "bad".
rotten
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［làn］
["Guangyun" Lang Jiqie, go to Han, come. ]
"Lian 2" was passed falsely. Also known as "爤1". Traditional characters for "烂1".
(1) Cook over fire.
(2) Refers to the soft state of the food after the food is cooked well or the fruit is over-ripe.
(3) Describe the sparse state of the object.
(4) Proficient; extremely familiar.
(5) Still very much; extremely. Indicates high or deep degree.
(6) Anything; whatever you want.
(7) Debauchery and intemperance.
(8) Burns; scalds.
(9) Rotting and corruption.
(10) Broken; tattered.
(11) Describes serious damage.
(12) Describes extremely painful or anxious heart.
(13) Confusion. See "bad debts", "mess".
(14) Literary words. A contemptuous term for a person or thing.
(15) Bright; bright.
(16) The colors are brilliant.
(17) Numerous appearances.
(18) Sheng, luxuriant.
rotten
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Si Collection] [Fire Word Department] 　bad; Kangxi Strokes: 21; Page Number: Page 687 25
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Yin Xiaoqie, Lan Qusheng. [Guang Yun] It's cooked well. 【Yangtze Dialect】From the north of the river, Zhao Weizhi was idle, and the fire was ripe and said to be bad. [Zuo Zhuan·Ding three years] Chu Zi throws himself into the bed, and wastes it in the charcoal.　[Guang Yun] Ming Ye. [Poetry·Zheng Feng] The stars are bad. Also 【Tang Feng】The brocade quilt is rotten. And [Daya] It's rotten and full of doors.
